thread.title: Diversified Royalty Corp. Announces Preliminary Q1 2018 Results for Mr. Lube, AIR MILES and Sutton

author: cnbc.com
title: Diversified Royalty Corp. Announces Preliminary Q1 2018 Results for Mr. Lube, AIR MILES and Sutton

organizations.name: first quarter results mr. lube canada limited partnership

text:
For Immediate Release – not for distribution to US news wire services or for US dissemination.
VANCOUVER, British Columbia, April 19, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Diversified Royalty Corp. (TSX:DIV) (TSX:DIV.DB) (the “Corporation” or “DIV”) is pleased to announce preliminary results for Mr. Lube, AIR MILES® and Sutton for the three months ended March 31, 2018 (“Q1”).
Mr. Lube First Quarter Results
Mr. Lube Canada Limited Partnership (“Mr. Lube”) generated same-store-sales-growth (“SSSG”) of 4.5% for the Mr. Lube stores in the royalty pool for the first quarter of 2018, compared to SSSG of 1.5% in the first quarter of 2017. Mr. Lube’s SSSG was driven by continued strong store-level execution and expansion of the tire business. In addition, Mr. Lube has opened 3 new locations in the past 5 months.
DIV expects to report that aggregate royalty income and management fees of $3.3 million were generated from Mr. Lube in the first quarter of 2018, an increase of $0.1 million from the first quarter of 2017.
AIR MILES ® First Quarter Results
The AIR MILES ® reward miles issued decreased by 1 % in Q1 and is trending to growth over the remainder of 2018, according to Alliance Data Systems Inc.’s (“ADS”) news release dated April 19, 2018.
DIV expects to report that royalty income of $1.73 million was generated from the AIR MILES ® licenses in the first quarter of 2018.
Sutton First Quarter Results
The unaudited first quarter results for Sutton Group Realty Services Ltd. (“Sutton”) were in line with expectations.
DIV expects to report that royalty income and management fees of $1.0 million were generated from Sutton in the first quarter of 2018, representing a 2% increase over the first quarter of 2017.
First Quarter Commentary
Sean Morrison, President and Chief Executive Officer of DIV stated, “As Mr. Lube opens new stores throughout 2018 and continues to promote and expand its tire services, we are confident that they will deliver consistent operating results. AIR MILES ® reward miles issued is stabilizing and is trending towards solid back-half growth, which is encouraging, while Sutton continues to perform as expected. Furthermore, DIV is actively pursuing business development and royalty acquisition opportunities to deploy its approximately $85M of cash on hand.”
The financial information contained in this news release is preliminary, is based upon the estimates and assumptions of the respective management of DIV, Mr. Lube and Sutton, as applicable, has not yet been approved by their respective Audit Committees or Boards of Directors, and has not been subject to a review by their respective auditors. The final Q1 financial results could differ materially from the above preliminary financial information. As previously announced, DIV expects to release its financial statements for Q1 on May 10, 2018 at which time DIV also expects to file the financial statements of Mr. Lube for the three months ended March 31, 2018.
About Diversified Royalty Corp.
DIV is a multi-royalty corporation, engaged in the business of acquiring top-line royalties from well-managed multi-location businesses and franchisors in North America. DIV’s objective is to acquire predictable, growing royalty streams from a diverse group of multi-location businesses and franchisors.
DIV currently owns the Sutton, Mr. Lube and AIR MILES ® trademarks in Canada. Sutton is among the leading residential real estate brokerage franchisor businesses in Canada with over 200 offices across Canada. Mr. Lube is the leading quick lube service business in Canada with 173 locations across Canada and over $225 million of annual system sales. AIR MILES ® is Canada’s largest coalition loyalty program with over 200 leading brand-name sponsors; approximately two-thirds of Canadian households actively participate in the AIR MILES ® Program.
DIV expects to increase cash flow per share by making accretive royalty purchases and through the growth of purchased royalties. DIV expects to pay a predictable and stable dividend to shareholders and increase the dividend as cash flow per share increases allow.
